title: fix opencv backend
Ctrls
body:
These are my fixes for the win32 control mechanism...
Some controls with present value equal to the minimal or maximal value are still not being listed...

title: Syntax highlighting in readme
body:
Hi! This makes the readme a bit more readable. I also fixed the comments in the `Cargo.toml` example.

Not sure why the `.ignore` were in the start of the code blocks, but maybe there's a good reason!

title: fix "cannot closed window" in capture
body:
Thank you for your great crate! I made some corrections to `examples/capture`.

The most significant change
The current implementation of the `senpai` branch is very expensive because it runs the drawing process for all events, even mouse movements, etc. This may be the reason why the window does not close on `x`. If the events are separated by event type and only drawn when they should be, the problem of not closing the window on x can be solved.

Some small changes
- To measure the time to get a frame, elapsed time can be obtained by elapsing the instance launched before getting the frame after getting the frame.
- The output of `glium` is gamma-corrected by default in Windows. This is not very desirable in this case, since we want to output the image as it is obtained from the camera. This can be avoided by adding the option `output_srgb: true` in the program macro.
- All warnings given by `cargo clippy --all` have been fixed.

title: Remove Sync restriction from CallbackCamera
body: The `Sync` restriction on the callback from `CallbackCamera` is, as far as I know, not necessary, as the callback itself is never shared between threads. This allows to use mpsc channels within the callback, along other nice features.

title: Fix a assert failure with YUYV format
body:
Or it would always fail due to the `dest` length being 0.    
https://github.com/l1npengtul/nokhwa/blob/043d326583c1ea82e0e8f6f62a267cea954a751a/src/utils.rs#L1238-L1246

title: Fixed in-buffer frame decoding
body:
* Dropped UVC backend
* Updated mozjpeg to a forked 0.9.1 version supporting in-buffer decoding
	* Ideally a PR should be done to mozjpeg-rust to mainline this change
* Modified existing decoding methods to take rgba as a parameter
	* yuyv422_to_rgb888 / yuyv422_to_rgba => yuyv422_to_rgb
	* mozjpeg_to_rgb888 / mozjpeg_to_rgba => mozjpeg_to_rgb
* Added in-buffer decoding methods
	* buf_yuyv422_to_rgb
	* buf_mozjpeg_to_rgb
	* Note: the aforementioned existing decoding methods allocate a sizable `Vec` then call into those new methods.
* Simplified code in some places
* Removed `^version` in `Cargo.toml` dependencies as `^` is always implied

title: Feature boxed callback
body:
This pull request consists of two cosmetic changes and a new feature:

**Remove not necessary lifetime specifiers**: Rust didn't let me compile my code with them in place, so remove them
```
error[E0107]: this struct takes 0 lifetime arguments but 1 lifetime argument was supplied
   --> nokhwa/src/query.rs:290:40
    |
290 | fn query_gstreamer<'a>() -> Result<Vec<CameraInfo<'a>>, NokhwaError> {
    |                                        ^^^^^^^^^^---- help: remove these generics
    |                                        |
    |                                        expected 0 lifetime arguments
```
**Fix threaded example camera index**: Seems as new `CameraIndex` didn't yet make it into example code, fixed this.

**Add boxed callback for CallbackCamera**: Currently, `CallbackCamera` only accepts a function as callback. Why not make it more flexible to accept an `Box<dyn FnMut()>`? This can take a function as usual (so no need to change existing code), but this can e.g. also take a closure!
Tested using my own code (passing a closure); tested using example code (passing a function).

title: Revert "0.9.2 - Merge Media Foundation back into main dev branch"
0.9.2 - Merge Media Foundation back into main dev branch
Fix V4L2 camera exposure control
body:
Set Exposure control id to
(0x009a0000 | 0x900) + 0x2 == 10_094_850
as specified in
https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/master/include/uapi/linux/v4l2-controls.h

Also make sure to return the CameraControl matching the argument
provided to camera_control(), not the first known camera control.

title: update quaternion to fix upside down
body: This fixes a upside down bug of `capture` example. I confirmed on `0.3.2`.

title: Remove default features from image crate dependency
body:
Removes a lot of additional crate dependencies that are pulled in by default.

Those crates aren't really necessary if only the generic image buffer is used.
(unless I overlooked something, only built it on Linux)

title: Update ouroboros [fix potential UB]
body: A potential source of undefined behavior was discovered in ouroboros. This PR updates it to the latest version 0.10.0 which fixes the problem. The update also drops the requirement that referenced fields exist in a Box or another container, so this PR also unboxes those fields.

title: Fix issue #3
body: Fixes issue #3, correctly converting YUYV to RGB888.
